{"step_by_step_thinking": "A dentigerous cyst is a type of odontogenic cyst, which is associated with the crown of an unerupted or developing tooth. It is the second most common type of odontogenic cyst. The most common neoplasia associated with dentigerous cysts is ameloblastoma, which is a benign, slow-growing tumor that originates in the cells that form the enamel of the teeth. Adenocarcinoma and fibrosarcoma are not typically associated with dentigerous cysts.", "answer_choice": "A. Ameloblastoma"}
